intro: Hieracium subchlorophaeum, commonly known as the pale-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a pale green coloration, which distinguishes it from other hawkweed species. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months.
